trans-unit.source: Provides information about the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> elements within a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref>.
PageContent elements are the only allowable child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument>.
The order of the PageContent elements within the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> defines the page order.

PageContent provides information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> elements within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> without the requiring the application to load individual pages.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> dependency property specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

For more information about the PageContent element, see Chapter 3 of the XPS *Open XML Paper Specification* available for download at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref>.
The Child property returns a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> when: 1.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> has an immediate <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> child defined in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] markup.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.System%23Windows%23Markup%23IAddChild%23AddChild%2A> has been called to set the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> as the child of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent>.
The Child property returns **null** when: 1.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property (when specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is not cached).

Use <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRoot%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> to return the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> when set by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property.

For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> element, see Chapter 3 of the XPS *XML Paper Specification* available for download at [http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/xpsspec.mspx](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/xpsspec.mspx).
## XAML Text Usage You cannot use this property in XAML.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref>, or **null** when the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source*> property.
Loads and returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content element.
GetPageRoot performs synchronous loading and parsing of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
> [!NOTE] > Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A>instead of GetPageRoot to avoid thread blocking while the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> loads.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to always reload the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> even if it has been previously loaded and cached; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to load the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> only if there is no cached version.
The root element of the visual tree for this page.
Asynchronously loads and returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content element.
GetPageRootAsync asynchronously loads and parses the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> data stream associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent>.
Other threads will continue to run while GetPageRootAsync completes.
The following steps illustrate how to load the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> content asynchronously: 1.
Create a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventHandler> delegate and add it to be notified of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> events.
Call GetPageRootAsync.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> event occurs and the delegate is called, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> content has completed loading.

The loaded <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> element is returned through the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventArgs>.<xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventArgs.Result%2A> property.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to always reload the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> even if it has been previously loaded and cached; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to load the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> only if there is no cached version.
Cancels any current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync*> operation in progress.

GetPageRootAsyncCancel cancels any <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> operation that has not already finished with a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> event.
Occurs when <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync*> has completed.
The GetPageRootCompleted event is handled by methods based on the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventHandler> delegate.
To be added.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget"></xref> elements that identify the hyperlink-addressable locations on the page.
LinkTargets will never return `null`, but the collection may contain zero elements.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).

The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTargetCollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget"></xref> elements that identify the hyperlink-addressable locations on the page.
To be added.

Gets a value indicating whether the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Child*> property should be serialized when this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> is serialized.
The serialization services provider.
if manager is not and it does not have an XmlWriter; otherwise, .
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] to the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content data stream.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element and its `Source` attribute, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref:System.Uri> of the corresponding <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source*> dependency property.
To be added.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddChild%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child <xref:System.Object> to add.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddText%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext.BaseUri%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext> interface.
The base URI of the current context.
